Responsify WP

Cares about responsive images. So should you

Download

Responsive images.
Plug and play

Responsify WP finds all images inside the_content() and makes them responsive.

Before

<article>
    <h1>Hello world</h1>
    <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet...</p>
    <img src="[full-size-image]" alt="Image description">
</article>

After

<article>
    <h1>Hello world</h1>
    <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet...</p>
    <img sizes="100vw" 
        srcset="[thumbnail] 150w,
        [medium-size-image] 300w,
        [large-size-image] 1024w,
        [full-size-image] <image-width>"
        alt="Image description">
</article>

Image. Or picture

Use img with srcset/sizes attributes. Or the picture element. Responsify WP supports both.

img[srcset/sizes]

<img sizes="100vw" 
        srcset="[thumbnail] 150w,
        [medium-size-image] 300w,
        [large-size-image] 1024w,
        [full-size-image] <image-width>"
        alt="Image description">

picture

<picture>
    <source srcset="[full-size-image]" media="(min-width: 1024px)">
    <source srcset="[large-size-image]" media="(min-width: 300px)">
    <source srcset="[medium-size-image]" media="(min-width: 150px)">
    <img srcset="[thumbnail" alt="Image description">
</picture>

Handpick sizes

<?php

// Using get_posts()
$posts = get_posts( array(
    'post_type' => 'portfolio',
    'rwp_settings' => array(
        'sizes' => array('large', 'full')
    )
) );
foreach ( $posts as $post ) {
    // ...
}
?>
